oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Memorandum from U.S. Commissioner of Education regarding desegregation and federal funding, 1966 March 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Howe II, Harold
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Memorandum from U.S. Commissioner of Education Harold Howe II informing all superintendents that federal funding for public schools will henceforth depend on compliance with Title VI of the Civil Rights Act of 1964.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Segregation in education -- Law and legislation; Segregation in education -- Tennessee -- Chattanooga
United States Office of Education (Washington, D.C.)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: Chattanooga Board of Education meeting agendas, reports, and correspondence, 1965-1966
Chattanooga Board of Education records and correspondence, 1965-1969
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:isPartOf: Raymond B. Witt Chattanooga Public Schools desegregation records
